pros: Great team, lots of fun to work with
cons: Not for you if you’re not a morning person

pros: Great relationship with the Kraft group; new president with a great vision
cons: has its challenges, but where doesn't

pros: Friendly supervisors and flexible schedule.
cons: Can be difficult to balance with school work.

pros: Um....I made some valued connections and friends
cons: Environment is stressed, stressful, and cliquey. My division was run by 2 undereducated angry old ladies with a penchant for gossip and axes to grind especially against younger women. Lots of pressure, the goal posts keep changing, and it's never enough. Everyone always encouraged to come in early, stay late, attend every sporting or cultural event, and work weekends. "Other duties as assigned" governs daily life. No decision making power or leadership opportunities....just do as you you're told. Miserable. High, high turnover for a reason. Multiple weeks of vacation dates with blackout dates 9 months of the year so impossible to use.

pros: Small community and great staff
cons: There is little room for growth

job_title: Digital Studios Assistant in Franklin, MA
pros: Amazing people to work with and easy, laid back job
cons: Limited work hours during second semester

pros: There are some nice people.
cons: The President is super cra-cra.

review_title: Give all and hope they like you.
pros:
Good co-workers among most of the faculty.
Classroom freedom is common.
cons:
Administration can turn on you.
Pay is only OK.
Complete dedication to school is demanded.
A "what have you done for me lately" attitude is common especially if you hope to climb to a higher rank.

pros: Good benefits, beautiful campus, nice coworkers
cons: Time for new leadership, very hard to get promoted

pros: Community and Students. Rewarding career but you're living and working in a fish bowl.
cons: Everything else! No work-life balance and if you are not in the clique, than they don't care about you. Avoid working here.

review_title: lots of work for little pay
pros: Interesting students, beautiful campus cool perks for students, they try to support their students, great facilities, people and staff care about each other
cons: By far the lowest paying school but their students need a lot of support from professors. There are a lot of different reports and paperwork required of staff to fill out about students that are having difficulty. Students are all over academically and behaviorally so the classroom can be challenging and exhausting. None of these things would be a con if the school paid a fair rate (at least industry standard). I've taught there for five years and never have received a raise, seriously. Why do I put up with it? I like the students and agree to teach their classes last because they pay the least for the most amount of work.

review_title: Executive Assistant to the Vice President Enrollment & Retention
pros: I came to Dean to provide health benefits for my family when my husband started his own business over 30 years ago.  What kept me here is the friendly and supportive work environment, the mentorship from my supervisors, and the fact that I feel valued and a part of a dedicated team.  The commitment of faculty and staff, who work tirelessly to support Dean's mission to provide our students with the opportunity for academic and personal success is real at the College.  We call it "The Dean Difference".  Having earned my degree from Dean (another benefit) as an adult learner, I have witnessed this dedication from both an employee's and a student's perspective.
cons: While Dean has its share of "drama" choosing to stay clear of it is easy to maneuver.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Franklin, MA
pros: Dean College is a place of work that cares not just for the students well being but the Faculty and Staff.  Dean demonstrates this by providing us with good benefits, training and establishing a rapport between employee and administrators.  Dean offers events and activities such as an ice cream social, a welcome back bbq, an end of the year celebration and employee recognition celebration.  Each of these brings staff and administration together in a less formal but meaningful way.  Dean offers staff and administration the wonderful opportunity to connect with students through Late Night Breakfast during exam weeks, serving Thanksgiving Dinner, Fresh Check In Day, Welcome Back BBQ, Food Pantry and Graduation.  As I mentioned in my headline, the Dean Difference is real.
cons: There are the occasional weekend days that staff and faculty are expected to work for Dean events.  Dean does compensate us with thank you days over the course the year.

pros: The students I meet come in all shapes and sizes.  They come to Dean because it is a community of people who care.  I've watched faculty and staff go the extra mile (and a half) to help students.  Been here a long time and watched the students grow because of the way every student gets treated as an individual and helped to find the path that works for them.  The people at Dean care!
cons: Caring is hard work.  You have to be committed to it.  They call it The Dean Difference and it means giving it a lot of energy.  But, that's a good thing because these kids know that you do.

pros: You have to love this job to enjoy it. Great resume builder and opportunity to engage with the residential students and a large portion of the campus community. Good chance to step into a student leader role on campus and meet new people both on and off staff who you normally wouldn't interact with. This job helped boost my confidence.
cons: Very small stipend for lots of work and time. Some of the residents will require a lot of attention and guidance. Other schools offer free room/board, Dean does not. Some of the staff are hired who aren't a good fit for the job and it brings the entire team down.

pros: I worked with some wonderful people, and when you love working with students it makes tough administration pressures easier to handle.
cons: A lot of pressure from upper management to be someone you are not, it feels all very fake. There is more emphasis on how things look rather than if it's truly working. The good people get experience and leave as quickly as possible.  When the good people left, the admin had a direct line into my department and it made working life unbearable.  You will definitely work more than 40 hours and have to be there late and on weekends. No room for growth.

pros: Students, nice campus and nice cafeteria.
cons: Dean claims to be helpful to students of extra needs.  These are untrue claims and they are really only doing what the state requires them to be doing by law.  However their marketing will tell you that they specialize in student need.  The people they have in place are great, but they are not all trained in additional needs for students who have special needs.  Dean is typically not these student's first choice as it is, and this environment's attitude it the result of that.   Work morale has been low there since they let the security staff go, and the people that used to stick up for you have all left.

review_title: They care when you are paying your tuition.
pros: Its a pay check every Friday and the college is close to home. Students and fellow workers are friendly and a pleasure to work with.  Went to school there, so there is a special place in my heart for this school.
cons: Management are another story. They don't value their employees! Unless you are a vice president, you don't matter to them. The pay is pretty low for a private college where the tuition is $50,000 per year. Management lie to their employees and just don't care.

review_title: Had a great experience at Dean. Everyone was very welcoming and helpful in my experience their. felt like I was family.
job_title: Assistant Baseball Coach in Franklin, MA
pros: just an all around positive atmosphere.  Everyone welcomes you with open arms and willing to work together as a team in times of need.
cons: Do not really have much to say other than its a growing institution so the funds were not quit there but on their way.

pros: Most of the staff are decent people trying to do their best for the students and the institution.
cons: Leadership is selfish and narcissistic.  The president is a tyrant who lies, lives in denial, terrorizes the staff and drives out talented, committed staff.  She has a reputation throughout the college for not telling the truth.

pros: Incredibly passionate community, students success was always priority number one.
cons: Depending on your territory be prepared to travel, a lot, but you'll be supported by the staff. The travel is a nice way to beef up some credit card points too.

pros: Dean is a very close-knit community.  Colleagues become friends who are like family.
cons: There are no cons to working here.  Dean is a wonderful place.

pros: Love the students, fun environment and culture!
cons: Wish I could teach more times during the week! But understand that the need isn't there!

pros: Good community and environment, people are great to work with.
cons: You do not get paid very much for the amount of work you do.

pros: Great management personal along with Excellent Co  workers!
cons: No downsides whatsoever! Pleasant place for employment!

review_title: Check the news/web to find the truth before applying
pros: Some good people, nice area to work
cons: Upper management entrenched, arrogant, ruthless and utilize contract labor for virtually every job on campus.
